title: Music-KG-Project
description: The Music Sampling Knowledge Graph project involves constructing a knowledge graph that maps relationships between various music samples, artists, and tracks. It includes tools for data extraction, transformation, and visualization, facilitating in-depth analysis of music sampling patterns.

title: CascaProject
description: The Casca Project automates the evaluation of loan eligibility by converting financial documents into images and analyzing them using OpenAI's GPT-4 model. This process streamlines financial assessments, enhancing efficiency and accuracy.

title: SetupForge
description: SetupForge is a Windows desktop application developed in C++ using wxWidgets, designed to automate software installation and system configuration tasks. It enables users to create, edit, and execute custom installation scripts for operations like running executables, managing files and directories, setting environment variables, editing the registry, and mapping network drives.

title: cs566-project
description: OneNet is a channel-wise 1D convolutional U-Net designed for efficient and accurate segmentation of 1D data sequences. The project includes comprehensive tools for training, evaluation, and visualization, facilitating in-depth analysis and application of the model.

title: E-DataSync-Distributed-E-Commerce-Inventory-Management
description: E-DataSync is a distributed e-commerce inventory management system designed to efficiently handle inventory data across multiple locations. The project encompasses backend database management, a user-friendly web interface, and various application pages to streamline inventory tracking and operations.

title: pe-consensus-scoring
description: The "PE Consensus and Scoring" project implements consensus and scoring algorithms for Public Editor, deployed on AWS Lambda. It processes messages from an SQS queue to handle tasks such as calculating consensus, publishing articles, and unpublishing articles.

title: software-dev
description: The software-dev repository contains prototype files developed by the Public Editor Software Development Team. It includes various components such as web scrapers, Chrome extensions, visualization tools, and mobile applications, all aimed at enhancing the Public Editor platform.

title: 2022-wi-stats21
description: The repository contains instructional materials for an introductory statistics course, including class notes, assignments, and resources on topics such as data types, Git basics, and Jupyter Notebook usage.

title: CalHackss
description: The CalHackss repository contains a portion of the code developed during the CalHacks hackathon. Due to GitHub's storage limitations, the full codebase isn't uploaded.

title: chrisapton.github.io
description: The repository at [chrisapton.github.io](https://github.com/chrisapton/chrisapton.github.io) contains the source code for my personal website, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript files, and assets like images and PDFs.

title: Coding_Assessment_2024
description: The "Applicant Compatibility Scoring System" is a Python script that evaluates candidates for a technical team by calculating compatibility scores based on attributes such as intelligence, strength, endurance, and tolerance for spicy food. It utilizes NumPy and pandas for data processing and requires an input JSON file named `input.json` to operate.

title: Heart-Disease-Prediction
description: The Heart Disease Prediction project involves analyzing heart disease datasets using machine learning techniques to predict the likelihood of heart disease in patients. The repository includes R scripts, datasets, and a comprehensive report detailing the methodology and findings.

title: MITHacks
description: Enlighten Me is a web application featuring a Python backend with Flask and a frontend built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React. It presents users with a "Change My Mind" image displaying a controversial topic, prompting a 5-minute debate session. After each session, the site refreshes with a new topic and clears the chat, facilitating continuous, topic-focused discussions.

title: projects
description: The GitHub repository at [chrisapton/projects](https://github.com/chrisapton/projects) currently contains a `README.md` file and a `hello.txt` file, but lacks detailed descriptions or content. It appears to be a placeholder or an initial setup for future projects.

title: round_robin
description: The "Encore Round Robin Website" repository contains the source code for the website [roundrobinstore.com](https://roundrobinstore.com), including HTML, CSS, and image files. It serves as the platform for providing updates and features related to the Encore Round Robin store.

title: STATS-199-Research-SPR-2023
description: The STATS-199-Research-SPR-2023 repository contains materials from a research project conducted during the Spring 2023 semester. It includes Jupyter notebooks, a final project report, and code files related to statistical analysis and modeling.
